main event: A sighting of an unconventional aircraft involving a brilliant white light was reported at Shaw AFB, S.C. on 1 October 1952 by a KFR-60 Pilot (USAF) who observed the object for 23 minutes.
interesting points: The object was described as a brilliant white light, three times as intense as sunlight, with no discernible aerodynamic features, trail, or sound.
The aircraft pilot attempted to intercept the object and alert ground radar but was unsuccessful.
The object was observed performing impossible maneuvers, including horizontal flight, vertical flight, still flight, sudden turns, and extreme speeds without approaching the aircraft.
The pilot, Capt. Billet, was a highly qualified reconnaissance pilot and a veteran of combat operations in the Korean War, making him a credible witness.
Despite the clear weather with full moon and the absence of physical evidence, the report describes the sighting as a true and exact copy with no explanation for the observed object.
sighted object: brilliant white light with impossible maneuvers
